executive_summary: Security analysis identified 4 critical and 4 high-risk issues requiring immediate attention. If left unresolved, these issues may lead to unauthorized access, data exposure, or full system compromise.

technical_findings.risk_explanation: Secrets stored in code are easily exposed via source control
technical_findings.recommended_action: Move secrets to environment variables or a secrets manager.

technical_findings.risk_explanation: eval() enables arbitrary code execution if input is untrusted
technical_findings.recommended_action: Avoid eval(). Use safe parsing or explicit logic.

technical_findings.risk_explanation: Multiple security issues including information disclosure
technical_findings.recommended_action: Review and remediate according to security best practices.

technical_findings.risk_explanation: Exposes SSH to brute-force and remote exploitation
technical_findings.recommended_action: Restrict SSH access to trusted IP ranges or use bastion hosts.

technical_findings.risk_explanation: Public buckets can leak sensitive data
technical_findings.recommended_action: Disable public access and use IAM-based access controls.

technical_findings.risk_explanation: Wildcard permissions allow full account compromise
technical_findings.recommended_action: Apply least-privilege permissions instead of wildcards.
